meanings.definition: Perceptible by touch; capable of being touched or felt.
meanings.sent1: The soft fur of the puppy was tangible to my fingertips.
meanings.sent2: The rough bark of the tree was tangible under my palm.
meanings.sent3: The tangible warmth of the sun made the picnic even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a tangible presence in the room, filling it with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was so tangible, you could almost reach out and grab it.

meanings.definition: Real or actual rather than imaginary or visionary.
meanings.sent1: The tangible results of his hard work were evident in the successful project.
meanings.sent2: The tangible evidence at the crime scene pointed to the suspect's guilt.
meanings.sent3: The tangible joy on her face was contagious, spreading smiles to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of success were finally becoming tangible, turning into reality.
meanings.sent5: The tangible sense of community in the neighborhood made everyone feel at home.
